remarks: Well-founded induction.  The proof has been taken from Chapter 4 of Don Monk's notes on Set Theory.  See ~ http://euclid.colorado.edu/~~monkd/setth.pdf .  (Contributed by Jonathan Ben-Naim, 3-Jun-2011.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
bnj1204.1 $e |- ( ps <-> A. y e. A ( y R x -> [. y / x ]. ph ) ) $.
bnj1204 $p |- ( ( R _FrSe A /\ A. x e. A ( ps -> ph ) ) -> A. x e. A ph ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d ph y $.
